full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 757 Filed 08/10/22 Page 12 of 49 1985 LC9VMAXT
1 MS. MOE: Yes, your Honor.
2 I have in trials in this district called summary witnesses who helped publish and connect up facts across exhibits without creating summary charts under Rule 1006. I think this testimony --
3 THE COURT: You're not offering him under 1006.
4 MS. MOE: That's correct, your Honor.
5 THE COURT: And he isn't involved in the investigation.
6 MS. MOE: That's correct, your Honor.
7 We'd just like an opportunity to publish these exhibits in a way that facilitates the jury seeing them without doing this through lay witnesses where there are complications about reading things out loud, so that it's streamlined and efficient so the jury can see the evidence that's been admitted. We think that's appropriate.
8 THE COURT: Why not just do it in closing?
9 MS. MOE: Your Honor, I think to rest our case and have the jury not see some of the evidence in this case, our preference would be --
10 THE COURT: The one thing I've seen that it sounds like you're saying is actually not with a witness, but a bunch of documents come in, and then the government spends a little bit of time just publishing, publish this and publish that.
11 Again, I've never seen -- never seen -- an agent, a
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00013553
